speaker: Chapel of Ash
line: The nave is cold, but the candles are warm—recently lit, deliberately placed. Someone is trying to keep the dark from learning your name.

speaker: Dying Priest
line: Don’t kneel. The floor remembers too much.

speaker: Acolyte Sera
line: Forgive him—he hasn’t slept since the bells went wrong. If you’re armed, keep it lowered. If you’re honest, keep it closer.

choices.text: I can help, if there’s work that matters.

speaker: Dying Priest
line: There’s a hollow in the world. Not a place—an absence. People walk around it until they’re tired, then they step into it because it feels like rest.

speaker: Acolyte Sera
line: We call it the Hollow City. The name is a warning pretending to be geography.

speaker: Dying Priest
line: Because they want answers that don’t bleed. Because they think authority can replace faith. Because the world taught them to obey—then stopped explaining why.

speaker: Acolyte Sera
line: Take a blessing, traveler. Not a shield—just a reminder that you can still choose.

choices.text: Refuse. I don’t trust borrowed comfort.

speaker: Chapel of Ash
line: As you step away, the candleflames lean toward you—then straighten, as if embarrassed to be seen caring.
